questions.question_text: How would you deploy your "Terms of Services" page to all managed ChromeOS devices?

choices.B: Go to "User & Browser" and "Managed Guest Session" settings to upload your terms of service
choices.C: In "User & Browser Settings" upload the "Terms of Service" as a wallpaper
choices.D: Navigate to "User & Browser" and "Managed Guest Session" settings to upload your custom avatar
choices.A: Navigate to "Chrome Verified Access" and enable the policy for content protection

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
There's a Setting in Devices > Settings > Users & Browsers to Upload Terms that users must agree to.

Selected Answer: C
There's a Setting in Devices > Settings > Users & Browsers to Upload Terms that users must agree to.

Selected Answer: B
To deploy a Terms of Service (ToS) page to all managed ChromeOS devices, you can use the Managed Guest Session (MGS) settings within the Google Admin Console. In the Managed Guest Session settings, there is an option to display a custom Terms of Service (ToS) page before users can sign in to the device. This is a common method for organizations to ensure users acknowledge the terms and conditions when they first use a device, especially for guest users or shared devices.

Selected Answer: B
Quick glance says B.

questions.question_text: Within what time frame does the ChromeOS Flex upgrade transfer program support reusing Chrome Education/Enterprise Upgrades?
Which feature of the Google Admin console allows you to restrict devices from remembering user passwords?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Looks like B fits best.

questions.question_text: What should you do to activate biometrics unlock for the devices that support it?

choices.B: Upgrade device license to "Chrome Security Plus"

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Kinda torn, but D looks most likely.

questions.question_text: A customer wants to deploy kiosks in approximately 1000 retail stores. The customer has decided they would like to use ChromeOS devices for this deployment. The customer requires the ability to run a managed Chrome Browser along with a custom developed Chrome application. How would an administrator satisfy the customer requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Honestly? I'd go A.
